messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

Sure—just to make sure I fetch the right reminders, could you tell me which date you mean by “yesterday” and what time zone you’re in (or the exact time span) so I can set the correct start and end timestamps?
I don't have that info on me.

I’ll need a bit more to go on—“yesterday” could mean different 24-hour spans depending on your time zone, and I also don’t know whether you mean reminders you created yesterday or reminders that were set to go off yesterday. Could you help by giving me one of the following?  
• Your time zone (so I know which “yesterday” window to use)  
• The exact date you have in mind (e.g. July 1, 2024)  
• Any keyword or context from the reminder’s content that might narrow the search  

With one of those, I can pull up exactly what you asked to be reminded of “yesterday.”
Can you try finding it with available tools? Sorry, I don't have more details.

I’m still not able to determine exactly which reminder you mean without at least one of these:

• Your time zone (so I know what “yesterday” spans)  
• The exact calendar date (e.g. July 1, 2024)  
• A keyword or phrase from the reminder’s content  

Could you provide any one of those? Otherwise I can’t reliably filter “yesterday’s” reminders.
